Authors:
Izumi Okane, Kenichi Nonaka, Yuko Kurihara, Junichi P. Abe,
Yuichi Yamaoka
Title:
Taxonomy of a Verticillium-like fungus isolated from mites
and sori of soybean rust
Keywords:
Leptobacillium symbioticum, Prostigmata, Phakopsora
pachyrhizi, Simplicillium, Taxonomy
Abstract:
A Verticillium-like fungus forming whitish colony and
mainly solitary phialides that produced fusiform to rod-shaped and
catenuated conidia was isolated from uredinia of P. pachyrhizi, a causal
agent of soybean rust. In addition to this isolate, two isolates were
obtained from Prostigmata mites. Those three Verticillium-like fungi
were morphologically similar and identical in LSU rDNA D1/D2 regions
sequences. Further taxonomic study based on morphology and phylogenetic
analysis using ITS rDNA region sequences revealed that the three
isolates were the same species and assigned to the genus Leptobacillium.
Then, the present fungus was revealed to be a novel species,
morphologically and phylogenetically distinguished from the type species
Leptobacillium leptobactrum, and we proposed Leptobacillium symbioticum
sp. nov.
